N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9003.22 - Unhygienic use of fountains and pools

State Regulations

No person shall use any water fountain, drinking fountain, pool, sprinklers, or any other water contained in or adjacent to any park for
the purpose of washing or cleaning himself or herself, his or her clothing or
other personal belongings. This section shall not apply to those areas within
the parks which are specifically designated for personal hygiene purposes
(i.e., bathrooms, shower rooms, or similar facilities), provided, however, that
no person shall wash his or her clothes or personal belongings in such area, nor shall any person who has not been using a facility under the jurisdiction
of ParksCorp for recreational purposes be permitted to use such an area within
such facility for personal hygiene purposes. Notes
